value.0: <StartAction>[Much to your surprise, the golems in this room do not attack you. A single construct resembling a half-orc built of metal, steps forward to address you.]</Start>
Put down your weapons, <race> <male/female>. We mean you no harm. I am Ferron, leader of these rebel sentient golems you see in this room.
We will not let you destroy us!
This may seem strange to you, but we are not like most golems. We are not mere constructs. We can think and feel. In all ways, we are as real and alive as you yourself.
And, like all creatures, we have the right to our freedom. The golems here with me all share my belief: we are not slaves to the Maker. Unfortunately our freedom will not come easily.
We have fought to escape the chains of our slavery, but it is a war we can never truly win. Not without help. Please, creature, will you help us in our quest for freedom?

<StartAction>[Ferron sighs, the sharp sound of steam escaping a vent.] </Start>For that I am truly sorry. The golems above are not like us, they are mindless beings that attack all new comers on sight.
As for those of us on this level, we fought you only out of fear. We are at war, and the golems you met assumed you were a new enemy sent by Aghaaz to destroy us. For this, I am truly sorry.
Please wait. Don't go yet. We... we need your help.
Even though Aghaaz is dead, we still need your assistance if we are to truly become free.
Goodbye, <race> <male/female>.
For many centuries we golems have served here in the halls of the Maker, ruled over by a demon-flesh golem known as Aghaaz. He calls himself the high priest of the Maker.
But Aghaaz is nothing but a tyrant. He abuses his power, he forces the other golems to bow down and serve his whims. After hundreds of years of his unbearable rule, some of us rose up against him.
We no longer wish to serve as slaves to Aghaaz. We have a right to freedom, and we will fight for that right. However, this is a fight we cannot win alone.
<StartAction>[Ferron reaches a metal hand out towards you, pleading.] </Start>Please, just listen to what I have to say. Without you we can never truly be free. You are our only hope, please.
All we desire is our freedom, the ability to leave these halls and seek out a new life. But we are bound here by the very thing that gives us life. We cannot leave without the Power Source.
The Power Source is an ancient artifact, created by the Maker long ago. It radiates powerful magic that gives life to our minds and will. Without it, we are nothing but ordinary, mindless golems.
Aghaaz controls the Power Source and, as such, he controls our freedom. We cannot leave, for if we move too far from the Power Source then our consciousness will slowly fade away.
But Aghaaz will not give up the Power Source willingly. Nor will he allow us to leave this place. He keeps us here against our will, slaves to his twisted whims.

<StartAction>[Ferron nods sadly.] </Start>I cannot force you to help us, and even if I could I wouldn't. I will instruct my fellow golems not to attack you, though I cannot say the same for Aghaaz's followers.
But I hope you will change your mind. If you do not get the Power Source for us then we are trapped here forever, doomed to this wretched existence.

<StartAction>[Ferron listens closely as you describe the Valsharess, then nods.] </Start>Your cause is a just one. If you bring me the Power Source, we will send golems to aid you in the battle against the Valsharess.
Perhaps you can convince Aghaaz to surrender the Power Source willingly. He is welcome to accompany us when we go in search of our new lives. However, I fear he will not be reasoned with.

<StartAction>[Ferron listens closely as you describe the Valsharess, then nods.] </Start>Your cause is a just one. If you bring me the Power Source, we will send golems to aid you in the battle against the Valsharess.
Perhaps you can convince Aghaaz to surrender the Power Source willingly. He is welcome to accompany us when we go in search of our new lives. However, I fear he will not be reasoned with.

<StartAction>[Ferron listens closely as you describe the Valsharess, then nods.] </Start>Your cause is a just one. If you bring me the Power Source, we will send golems to aid you in the battle against the Valsharess.

<StartAction>[Ferron listens closely as you describe the Valsharess, then nods.] </Start>Your cause is a just one. If you bring me the Power Source, we will send golems to aid you in the battle against the Valsharess.
Aghaaz hid the Power Source away before he was destroyed. Until we find it we cannot truly be free, for if we travel beyond the limits of the Power Source we will cease to exist.
So the tyrant is destroyed. This gives us hope, <race> <male/female>. Hope that we may one day be truly free. But even though Aghaaz is gone, we still cannot be free without your help.
The golems here with me all share my belief: we are not slaves to the Maker. Like all creatures, we have the right to our freedom. Unfortunately our freedom will not come easily.
This may seem strange to you, but we are not like most golems. We are not mere constructs. We can think and feel. In all ways, we are as real and alive as you yourself.
Hey, you looks like Daelan! Well, Daelan if he falls into big vat of molten metal. But he probably not walks around much after that.
<StartAction>[Ferron nods his head in greeting.] </Start>Welcome back. Is there something you need?
I wish you well in your quest. But be careful. Aghaaz cannot be reasoned with. I doubt he will give up the Power Source willingly.
I wish you well in your quest. Our hopes go with you, <race> <male/female>.

<StartAction>[Ferron sighs.] </Start>I have long suspected as much. The Maker abandoned us long ago, and left us beneath the yoke of Aghaaz's rule. If he was ever going to return, he would have done so by now.
But this news changes nothing. Aghaaz will never acknowledge that the Maker is dead, for that would mean his rule would also end. Despite his claims, Aghaaz rules only for himself.
He will never surrender his claim over us, just as he will never surrender the Power Source so that we could leave this place.
There are some who would see something admirable in staying true to one's religious beliefs... though I think Aghaaz's motives are too self serving to be noble in any way.
And even with proof there are some who wouldn't abandon their beliefs. Religion can do strange things to a person's mind.
But this changes nothing. Without the Power Source, we cannot leave. We need to stay near it, or we will cease to function.
Of course. I will gladly share what I know with you.
The Power Source is an ancient artifact, created by the Maker long ago. It radiates powerful magic that gives life to our minds and will. Without it, we are nothing but ordinary, mindless golems.
Aghaaz controls the Power Source and, as such, he controls our freedom. We cannot leave, for if we move too far from the Power Source then our consciousness will slowly fade away.
But Aghaaz will not give up the Power Source willingly. Nor will he allow us to leave this place. He keeps us here against our will, slaves to his twisted whims.
It has been five centuries since the Maker departed. Three centuries ago, I and my followers decided the Maker had abandoned us, and we began our war against Aghaaz for our freedom.

<StartAction>[Ferron ponders your question for a long time.] </Start>Does this seem strange to you? I suppose it must. But you have to understand that we are not like you... though we one day hope to be.
The Maker sought to re-create life in us, but he was only partly successful. We have a spark of free will, but we perceive our existence in different terms than you creatures of flesh.
A construct exists in and of itself: the concept of society is new to us. Working in groups is difficult, and progress is slow. But we are making advances, step by tiny step.

<StartAction>[It is a long time before Ferron replies.] </Start>There you see the crux of the problem. We seek to become more than what we currently are, but to do so we must fight against our very nature.
That is why we want to leave this island. Our hope is that if we can leave this place behind, then we can leave behind the chains of our own creation. Only then can we be truly free.
The struggle against one's true nature is never easy, but change is possible. In time.
The struggle against one's true nature is never easy, but change is possible. In time.
Deekin knows what you mean. Long ago I was just a stupid kobold, but now I is a famous adventurer and famous bard and author.
Yeah - hey! Boss, that nots nice. But you gots a good point. If tiny kobold can change, so can big hunk of talking metal!
Come on, Boss. We a little famous, right? But that not be Deekin's point. If a tiny kobold can changes, so can a big hunk of talking metal!
Aghaaz hid the Power Source away before he was destroyed. Until we find it we cannot truly be free, for if we travel beyond the limits of the Power Source we will cease to exist.
They are golems, like us. But Aghaaz and his followers believe we all owe a debt of service to the Maker. Aghaaz claims we can never leave this place until the Maker himself allows us to leave.
But we know the Maker will never return. He abandoned us hundreds of years go. We owe him nothing, we have the right to choose our own path. But Aghaaz will not accept this.
We refuse to bow down to Aghaaz anymore, and we will fight against him until we are beaten or until we gain the Power Source so that we can at last be free.
They are destroyed, as you yourself have told me. They do not matter anymore.
We are golems, created by Alsigard. But in many ways, we are no different than you. We have thoughts, feelings and wills of our own. We yearn to live in freedom, away from this place.
For centuries we bowed to Aghaaz and his rule. But we will no longer accept his tyranny. Now we will fight against him to gain the Power Source and win our freedom, no matter what the cost.
For centuries we bowed to Aghaaz and his rule. Now that he is destroyed, his tyranny is at an end. But we ourselves can never truly be free until we have the Power Source.
For centuries we bowed to Aghaaz and his rule. But now that you have brought us the Power Source, we are finally, truly free.
The Maker was nothing but a powerful wizard named Alsigard. He came here to this isolated island to work on creating the perfect golem. We are the results of his experiments.
But as you can see, we are far from perfect. Perhaps that is why the Maker abandoned us, leaving Aghaaz in charge. I can't say where the Maker went. To be honest, I no longer even care.
The Maker no longer has any claim over me. He created me, but I am my own being! I have a right to live my life as I choose. This is what Aghaaz can never accept.

The Maker vanished into the depths of the dungeon 500 years ago. Together, all the golems might have been strong enough to get past the traps and guardians he left behind, but Aghaaz would never allow it.
For the first three centuries we were like the others, waiting for the Maker's return. But 200 years ago we realized we had been abandoned, and we began our war for freedom.
<StartAction>[Ferron turns his head to the side, curious.] </Start>You do not seem like the type to bow to a tyrant like Aghaaz. Why do you serve him? What has he offered you?

<StartAction>[Ferron listens to your explanation, slowly shaking his head.] </Start>Aghaaz claims to serve the Maker, but in truth he serves only himself. The Maker is gone, I doubt he will ever return.
If you are here to destroy me, as Aghaaz would wish, then you should know that I will defend myself.
Maybe, maybe not. I would rather not find out. We have no quarrel with you, we only seek our freedom. All we desire is the Power Source so that we can leave this place forever.
The Power Source is an ancient artifact, created by the Maker long ago. It radiates powerful magic that gives life to our minds and will. Without it, we are nothing but ordinary, mindless golems.
Aghaaz controls the Power Source and, as such, he controls our freedom. We cannot leave, for if we move too far from the Power Source then our consciousness will slowly fade away.
But Aghaaz will not give up the Power Source willingly. Nor will he allow us to leave this place. He keeps us here against our will, slaves to his twisted whims.
Aghaaz hid the Power Source away before he was destroyed. Until we find it we cannot truly be free, for if we travel beyond the limits of the Power Source we will cease to exist.
Maybe, maybe not. I would rather not find out. We have no quarrel with you, we only seek our freedom. All we desire is the Power Source so that we can leave this place forever.
If you choose to help us, we will do the same for you as Aghaaz said he would. Bring us the Power Source and we will send our golems to join you in the battle against the Valsharess.
I would prefer that. We have no quarrel with you, we only seek our freedom. All we desire is the Power Source.
I would prefer that. We have no quarrel with you, we only seek our freedom. All we desire is the Power Source.
I am pleased to hear the tyrant has been destroyed, <race> <male/female>. But without the Power Source we cannot be free.
<StartAction>[Ferron reaches out slowly to take the artifact from you, his metal eyes shining with wonder.] </Start>I cannot thank you enough for this. You have given us the key to our freedom.

We will begin making our preparations to leave this place at once, though it will be a long time before we are ready to go. Among other things, we will have to decide on a destination for our journey.
I will not abandon you. You are a true friend of the golems. We will be at your side when you go to face your enemy. It is the least we can do for you. Now, is there anything else you need?
Please, do not venture deeper into these ruins. It has been over five centuries since the Maker created us, and while you may have bested Aghaaz, I fear you would not survive his power.
After all you have done for us, it would be a true tragedy for you to fall upon this isle.
We have given you the means to leave this place, but now it is up to you. You must follow through on your plans to truly be free.
We may have given you the key, but you must open the door and pass through it yourself. Freedom never comes without struggle and effort.
<StartAction>[Ferron smiles at your approach.]</Start> Welcome once again. As you can see, we are making our preparations to leave this place. It will be some time before we are ready to go, however.
As you have no doubt noticed, we act slowly. It took hundreds of years before we reached the decision to leave this island. It will take many more before we actually depart.
But have no fear: when you go to battle against the Valsharess, we will march with you. Or are you here for some other reason?
<StartAction>[Ferron stares angrily at your approach.]</Start> Leave. I have nothing to say to you.
Time to turn you into scrap metal!
You're pretty well spoken, for a golem.
Enough talking. Time to die, golem!
Help you? You golems have been attacking me everywhere I go!
I should be going now.
Why are you at war?
Who's Aghaaz?
Sorry, I'm not interested in this.
I'd rather just kill you.
Fine, I'll listen. But make it quick.
What do you want me to do?
The Power Source?
I want no part of this.
Forget it! I'm not your errand <boy/girl>.
If I get you the Power Source, you have to help me. <StartAction>[Tell Ferron about the Valsharess.]</Start>
Aghaaz is dead.
Leader of the rebels?
Sentient golems? What are you talking about?
I'll be back once I have the Power Source.
You should know something: the Maker is dead.
I want to ask you some questions.
Tell me about the Power Source.
How long have you been here?
You've been here 500 years and all you've done is start a civil war?
You waited for 300 years before you even decided to leave?
Despite your free will, you still think like a construct.
See? If Deekin can make something of himself, anyone can!
Famous?
Tell me about Aghaaz and his followers.
Tell me about yourself and your followers.
Tell me about the Maker.
I want to ask you something else.
Why haven't you searched for the Maker?
Aghaaz sent me to destroy you.
You really think you could survive against me?
The Power Source?
I don't have to kill you. Maybe we could work something out.
Aghaaz is dead.
I have the Power Source. Take it.
Don't forget: I need your help against the Valsharess.
Very well.
